desc: UPF1, involved in mRNA surveillance, is rarely mutated in cancers.

The UPF1 gene encodes a protein involved in mRNA surveillance. UPF1 has helicase and ATPase activity, and plays a role in nonsense-mediated decay (PMID: 11163187, 16086026, 21145460, 21419344). Recently, UPF1 function has been associated with prostate cancer progression (PMID: 23881279) and with SMAD7-mediated tumorigenesis in hepatocellular carcinoma (PMID: 26759305). UPF1 is rarely mutated in human tumors (cBioPortal, MSKCC, Dec. 2016).
